page.title: 03Tourism
page.content: In 1909, a man called Mr. Brierley planned out the land for the Haworth family. The Haworth home looks like a 17th Century home. The house is now used as an Art Gallery which displays Tiffany glass, paintings, sculptures, art from schools, local artists work and paintings which once belonged to the Haworth family. Joseph Briggs from Accrington worked for Louis Comfort Tiffany in America and brought back some of the famous glass in 1938. The gallery houses the biggest collection of Tiffany glass in Europe and must be seen by tourists. JKohn Ditchfield is a Modern glass worker and makes similar glass which can be seen and bo in the gallery. Enfield Training Centre which looks after people suffering from Downes Syndrome had a exhibition recently.
